classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B, Upper-Division C, and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Select from the following: ES340; ES/WGS 350; POLS310, POLS343, POLS419, POLS459, POLS471; POLS/UNIV 333; PSY310, PSY318, PSY330; PSY/CD 306; SOC305, SOC306, SOC309, SOC310, SOC327, SOC402, SOC406, SOC412; WGS301, WGS401; WGS/RELS 370.

If GE courses are taken for a letter grade and used as concentration electives, additional Free Electives may be required to complete the 180 total degree requirement. See College Advisor for additional information. Note: Check Tentative Course Offerings to see when certain classes are available, and plan accordingly.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.
